content: knit how to make cast on 50 stitches using the needles listed for your yarn choice pumpkin join for knitting in the round by sara heckman k3 p2 repeat around a quick project of seasonal cheer knit up a whole pumpkin patch continue in the established pattern of k3 p2 until piece measures worsted-8 inches bulky- 13 inches super bulky- 15 inches or- you have about 12 feet of yarn remaining break yarn leaving a tail of 10 inches of yarn using a tapestry needle thread through all the stitches on the needle removing the knitting needle as you work around once all stitches are on the yarn tail gently pull the yarn to cinch the end closed then secure the end by making yarn 90-100yards for all weights an x across the remaining opening this pattern is written for three yarn with the remaining yarn thread weights the only change you should through all stitches of the cast-on end make is the needle size these of the pumpkin opposite end stuff pumpkins are knit in the round with poly-fil or roving and gently pull tight to close the top as you did on the worsted us 8 16 circular needle other end bulky us 10 5 16 circular needle make the stem i-cord cast on 5 sts super bulky us 13 24 circular needle slide the stitches to the opposite side of the needle and knit across all stitches continue in this way until the stem measures the length you like bind off all sts use the tail to attach the stem to the top of the pumpkin
